Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
off-putting \off-putting\ adj. 1. hard to deal with.
Syn: awkward, disconcerting, embarrassing, sticky, tight, unenviable. [WordNet 1.5]
2. tending to repel.
Syn: unappealing. [WordNet 1.5]
The trappings of upper-class life are off-putting and sterile. --Elizabeth Hess
off-putting adj 1: causing annoyance or repugnance; "an off-putting remark" 2: tending to repel; "The trappings of upper-class life are off-putting and sterile"- Elizabeth Hess
